newsitem.title: GERMANY: Canadian 97/98 oilseeds output seen at 10.67 mln T.
newsitem.headline: Canadian 97/98 oilseeds output seen at 10.67 mln T.

text.p: Canadian oilseeds crops are forecast at 10.67 million tonnes in 1997/98 (Aug/July) after 8.11 million in 1996/97, the independent Oil World newsletter said.

The forecast included soybeans at 2.55 million tonnes (2.17 million in 96/97), canola at 7.00 million (5.04 million previously), linseed/flaxseed at 1.05 million (843,000) and sunseed at 70,000 (56,000).
Oil World said oilseeds would gain ground at the expense of grains because prices were high, supplies tight and prospective 96/97 carry-out stocks small.
The area sown to canola alone was forecast to expand to 13.0-13.5 million acres, up from 8.85 million last season, depending on spring planting weather.
Carry-over stocks of the four product groups at the end of July 1997 were pegged at 625,000 tonnes versus 1.36 million tonnes a year earlier.
Oil World said canola export availability should increase, as would that of oils and meals derived from canola and the other oilseeds.
